isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTERS AND COOLER - OIL COOLER AND COOLANT FILTER HEADER ASSEMBLY - INSPECTION AND REPAIR

step1.para:
Move the regulator valve by hand, to ensure it moves freely in the housing. Refer to Figure 9.43
and
9.44
.

Place the valve assembly on a hard flat surface. Using a wooden dowel, or similar object, depress the valve plunger until it bottoms. While holding the plunger in position, insert a wire such as a paper clip, through the valve housing and valve as shown in Figure 9.46
.

note.para: The following inspections can be performed without oil pressure regulator valve disassembly.

step1.para:
Visually inspect the retaining ring, ring groove and front edge of the oil pressure regulating valve. If the parts show any of the following, replace the valve assembly ( Figure 9.47
).

item.para: A deep groove from the outline of the retaining ring on the regulating valve.

figure.caption: Figure 9.45. Remove Oil Pressure Regulator Valve.
Figure 9.46. Positioning Oil Pressure Regulating Valve Assembly For Inspection.
Figure 9.47. Oil Pressure Regulating Valve Assembly Inspection Check Points.

note.para: If the oil pressure regulating valve has a broken or missing retaining ring it is recommended that the engine bearings and crankshaft be inspected for possible damage.

step1.para: If the oil pressure regulating valve shows no signs of fatigue or wear, apply pressure to valve plunger with the wooden dowel and remove the wire inserted in step 2.

note.para: If a new OPRV is installed on engines with Serial Numbers below 523351, stamp the valve cap with the number "5" or alpha "G" for identification purposes.
